programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: For Something Bigger
programme.desc: Alex Aust Holman has been one of the most impactful players in the modern era of women’s lacrosse. Now at the end of her career, she has the opportunity to create her legacy with the Maryland Charm.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: WLL Announcement Press Conference
programme.desc: Join Paul Rabil, Charlotte North, Izzy Scane, Alex Aust Holman, and Lizzie Colson as they take over Times Square to announce the brand new Women's Lacrosse League.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Ricky Miezan Feature
programme.desc: Follow the journey of former College Football star Ricky Miezan as he makes his professional Lacrosse debut for the California Redwoods in the 2024 Championship Series.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: 2025 Players' Roundtable: Kavanagh brothers, Shellenberger, Dobson, Reh & McAdorey
programme.desc: Six of the best players in the game sat down for a conversation about their biggest challenges, top accomplishments, and what it’s like being a pro lacrosse player today — on and off the field.

programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Ricky Miezan Feature
programme.desc: Follow the journey of former College Football star Ricky Miezan as he makes his professional Lacrosse debut for the California Redwoods in the 2024 Championship Series.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: 2025 Players' Roundtable: Kavanagh brothers, Shellenberger, Dobson, Reh & McAdorey
programme.desc: Six of the best players in the game sat down for a conversation about their biggest challenges, top accomplishments, and what it’s like being a pro lacrosse player today — on and off the field.

programme.title: Outlaws
programme.desc: The Lacrosse Network Presents a look into on the 2012 Denver Outlaws Training camp, their first memories of lacrosse, the sounds of the game, and a recap of their Championship game with RJ Kaminski.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. programme.title: All In - Atlas 2022
programme.desc: All in provides unbridled access to selected PLL teams – beginning with the squad's leader, the Head Coach. We cover on the field, in the locker room, and behind the scenes access through wins + losses.

programme.title: 2025 State of the League Conversation
programme.desc: Paul Rabil sits down with Paul Carcaterra for their annual state of the league conversation. They talked about the evolution of the pro game, the rise and dominance of younger pros, and the future of the PLL and WLL.

programme.title: Behind the Scenes: 2025 Rabil Overnight East
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes of Rabil Overnight East at IMG Academy! Day 1 kicked off with high vibes and even flyer gear. Days 2 & 3 brought fast and accurate shots, lockdown defense, hearty meals, new episodes of Rabil’s Places, and of course, Good Deals.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: For Something Bigger
programme.desc: Alex Aust Holman has been one of the most impactful players in the modern era of women’s lacrosse. Now at the end of her career, she has the opportunity to create her legacy with the Maryland Charm.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Kermet Apio: There's No I in Self Esteem
programme.desc: The Honolulu, Hawaii native discusses growing up in a tropical paradise, and things he’s realized while spending so many hours procrastinating.

programme.title: Sasheer Zamata: Pizza Mind
programme.desc: Sasheer ZamataÍs "Pizza Mind" will give viewers food for thought. In this all-new stand-up special, Sasheer covers a spectrum of topics, from drugs to relationships, Disney racism to politics _ nothing is off limits. This multi-talented comedian incorporates different performance elements to express her opinions and dive into her personal life, truly giving you a piece of her mind.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: Champion
programme.desc: Indomitable Steve Byrne brings the high-energy flair that earned him a nod as one of the best comics in the history of the Comedy Central Standup.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: Tell the Damn Joke
programme.desc: The comic brings his signature style to Chicago with an all-new comedy special that holds no punches, calls it like it is, and tells the damn jokes.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: The Byrne Identity
programme.desc: Comedian Steve Byrne, who has established himself as one of the premier stand-up comedians of his generation, delivers a new stand-up set.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: The Last Late Night
programme.desc: A veteran comedian bucks the traditional stand-up special format by delivering a sixty-minute set on his own late-night talk show.

programme.title: Tom Mabe: Dysfunction Junction
programme.desc: With more than 50-million views on YouTube, Tom Mabe's original songs, stories, and videos make for a night out you will remember for years.

programme.title: William Lee Martin: Standing in the Middle
programme.desc: The comedian cowboy talks about middle-aged, middle-class life in Texas in a divided world while balancing the duties of married life and five kids.

programme.title: Yakov Smirnoff: I Bet You Never Looked at It That Way
programme.desc: 10 years after being sworn in at Ellis Island, Yakov Smirnoff headlines his own theater in Branson, Missouri in a funny look at cultural differences.

programme.title: Yakov Smirnoff: Jokes From the Folks
programme.desc: The Branson, Missouri-based Russian comedian turns the floor over to his audience as they show that they’re just as funny as their cheery host.

programme.title: Rhys Darby: Mystic Time Bird
programme.desc: The Flight of the Conchords star known for his silly perspectives, physicality, and sound effects, discusses mysticism, past lives, and birds.

programme.title: Mike Birbiglia: My Girlfriend's Boyfriend
programme.desc: Comic Mike Birbiglia takes us on a painfully honest and hilariously entertaining journey through a lifetime of romantic bungles and missteps.

programme.title: Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing
programme.desc: The comic performs.

programme.title: Lisa Lampanelli: Back to the Drawing Board
programme.desc: The brash comedian talks candidly about her personal experiences, including body image and divorce. She includes more of her famous insult rants.

programme.title: Love Dump
programme.desc: A quirky, thrift shop owner meets a dog lawyer and they fall madly in love, however, her quest to find her missing father puts their relationship in jeopardy.

programme.title: Jasmine Ellis: Black Girl Panic
programme.desc: Jasmine Ellis reflects back at the formative experiences that formed her adulthood; to the delight of a full house in Austin, Texas, Ellis looks back at her parents, experiences in a mental hospital and interracial marriage as a Texan.

programme.title: Janeane Garofalo: If I May
programme.desc: This tangent filled special is sure to keep you on your toes. Janeane Garofalo takes on societyÍs intolerance of gluten and House Hunters International in her newest stand-up special filmed live in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bill Engvall: Here's Your Sign It's Finally Time My Last Show
programme.desc: After spending over four decades delighting audiences, the renowned comedian takes the stage for the last time in his farewell stand-up special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Margaret Cho: Psycho
programme.desc: The comic provocateur tackles a new list of taboos—from race to sexuality to Boko Haram—in front of a live audience at New York’s Town Hall.

programme.title: Maria Bamford: Local Act
programme.desc: Beloved comedian and best-selling author Maria Bamford reveals the joy and sense of community of being an LA comic in this intimate stand-up special.

programme.title: Henry Rollins: Keep Talking, Pal
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer, and musician discusses a chance encounter with David Bowie, the genius of RuPaul, and more in this hilarious set.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: Mahalo & Goodnight
programme.desc: In her fourth stand-up comedy special, Anjelah Johnson dishes on awkward massages, home invasions, spiders, and being a full-grown child.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: The Homecoming Show
programme.desc: The comic shares her stories of growing up with a sports enthusiast father who never wanted to pay for athletic training, and other hilarious tales.

programme.title: Bill Hicks: One Night Stand
programme.desc: It’s a wild night in 1989 of raucous fun as Bill Hicks shows us his unique view on smoking cigarettes, smoking pot, drinking, sex, advertising, and music.

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Reflections
programme.desc: Comedy Dynamics sits down with Bill Hicks’ brother, Steve, who tells old stories, squashes old rumors and reveals the brother and son behind the late comedian. Told amidst old and rare footage, it’s a must watch for any fan.

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Relentless
programme.desc: In this classic special from 1992, comedian Bill Hicks tells us how he feels about non-smokers, blow-jobs, religion, war, peace, drugs and music.

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Revelations
programme.desc: The comedian observes religion, evolution, childbirth and politics in London.

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Sane Man
programme.desc: Live comedy performed by Bill Hicks.

programme.title: Bob Stromberg: I'm a Pretty Big Deal
programme.desc: After forty years performing a blend of stand-up, story, and shtick, Bob Stromberg brings his style to the trials of aging.

programme.title: Buddy Fitzpatrick: Still In The Driveway
programme.desc: Buddy Fitzpatrick performs standup.

programme.title: The Guest List
programme.desc: Comedy showcases of the hottest standup comics, broadcast live from a VIP, guest-list-only speakeasy.

programme.title: Christine Hurley: Post-Vasectomy
programme.desc: Christine Hurley shares the story of her life, and she pulls no punches.

programme.title: Claudia Oshry: Disgraced Queen
programme.desc: As Instagram’s reigning disgraced queen, the comic takes on pop culture and all that is wrong with it, in an outrageous new stand-up comedy special.

programme.title: Clayton Fletcher: Middle Child Syndrome
programme.desc: The former musical theater major and current stand-up is a middle child who has opinions on everything from geography to religion to child-rearing.

programme.title: Collin Moulton: Anti Animal Vegan
programme.desc: The comedian talks about falling for a Midwestern woman, foods we take for granted, and his ultimate despisement of corn on the cob.

programme.title: Corey Rodrigues: People Whisperer
programme.desc: The acclaimed comedian uses his comedy special to discuss the attitudes of cats and why we should really reconsider our take on them.

programme.title: Dan Cummins: Don't Wake The Bear
programme.desc: Unabashedly tackling any subject from gun control laws to raising a child that is clearly smarter than you, Dan Cummins unloads some of his funniest material to date! Filmed over two sold-out shows at the historic Salt Lake City venue.

programme.desc: Bev experiences moments of clarity and reflection and asks Jackie to spend the day together in Chicago.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Plus, Frances visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn fast approaching, Monty is preparing the borders for the change of seasons and looking ahead to spring. Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit a glorious historic garden in North Yorkshire - Scampston Hall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests apples, pears and quince and plants indoor bulbs, we meet a Northern Irish daffodil breeder, and Carol Klein travels to Wales to explore the Eupatorium with a passionate gardener who has a rare and spectacular collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the wonder of trees and explore the vital role they play in gardens and the wider landscape. Zoe Ball joins Toby Buckland on a visit to a tree project in North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrate the bounty our gardens have to offer at this time of year as Carol Klein gathers wild blackberries, Monty Don is at Longmeadow, and we join a champion vegetable grower in Yorkshire as he prepares for the biggest show of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It is the autumn equinox and Monty celebrates the season's apple bounty. Monty also plans for Christmas when he plants bulbs to brighten dark winter days, and he gives advice on planting garlic for the following year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's dividing his Pulmonaria and gives advice on frost-protection, Joe visits a tropical oasis outside Bristol, and Carol looks at Rowans from around the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into more seasonal tasks. Joe Swift heads to Houghton Lodge Gardens in Hampshire renowned for its walled kitchen garden and heritage fruit collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow sharing a wealth of tips and ideas on how to keep your garden looking good all year long. He tackles some urgent pruning, and reveals some of the projects he's got in store over the coming months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Hellebores, the jewels of the early spring border, come under the spotlight on this show. Monty Don shares his top tips on how to get the best from them. Carol Klein visits a couple who have just moved into a bungalow with a badly neglected garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explains why he thinks that the once-popular chrysanthemum is worth revisiting and Joe Swift has some helpful suggestions if you're thinking of giving your garden a bit of a spring revamp.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants up a new bed of asparagus and shows us how to lift and divide hostas. On our second visit to South Africa, we explore the conditions that allow agapanthus to thrive in the wild.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don breaks ground for his new pond and Carol Klein pays Geoff and Sally Davis another visit in their Somerset garden. Their overgrown shrubs are in need of a jolly good haircut, but they haven't a clue where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the weather begins to warm up, there's plenty to be getting on with in the garden. Monty Don welcomes us to Longmeadow and cracks on with some timely tasks. Including Water Iris Garden, Peonies, Seaside Garden, National Gardening Week.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Magnolias are the showstoppers of the tree world right now and to celebrate them in all their glory, James Alexander-Sinclair pays Borde Hill Garden in West Sussex, with its collection of magnificent champion trees, a visit.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Everything in the garden is shooting up so it's time to lift and divide perennials and Monty is doing just that with his ornamental grasses. In our third trip to South Africa, we discover where red hot pokers grow in the wild.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty's wildlife garden begins to take shape at Longmeadow, bees are very much at the forefront of his mind. He plants up a nectar-rich border that will attract all sorts of bees and other pollinating insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the hanging basket season well and truly underway, Joe Swift meets a florist in Surrey who has perfected the art of kokedama, a modern take on the hanging basket. Houseplants come under the spotlight too.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow this week, Monty reaps a harvest from the vegetable garden, plants up a seasonal pot and gives a masterclass on how to make the perfect compost. Adam Frost travels to York to meet a couple who took on 20 acres of land and filled it with flowers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don and Nigel make the most of the season and prepare for the winter ahead. Meanwhile Carol Klein is in Surrey looking at wild and cultivated heathers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow with a host of seasonal jobs to keep his autumn garden looking beautiful for as long as possible, and in the third of her fascinating films about how plants work, Carol Klein investigates the science of stems.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team are back with the best practical tips and advice for gardeners of all levels. While Monty has lots of new projects at Longmeadow to share, Adam Frost visits a stunning Japanese garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than what’s in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The crew is all at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma kicking of the 2024 Rifle season.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Willi and Chris have hunted NM for years with some success each year. This year they include two new friends, Nick Ventura and his dad. They receive rain like they never had before and when they finally make it out to hunt, Willi is hoping to connect.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Good friend Mike Stone invites Willi to hunt his family ranch in Oklahoma. Good friend, Tom Petry goes along to film for his school, “Film The Hunt” and hopefully capture Willi shooting a good, Oklahoma buck.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we highlight some of the best diving in the lower Keys. From the wreck of the Vandenberg too the beautiful reefs in Key West, this show has it all.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: We're BACK in Lafitte continuing our adventure in Jefferson Parish. Join Louisiana Celebrity Chef Jay Ducote (known as the guy who beat Bobby Flay), alongside Philadelphia's own Chef Brian Duffy (famous from Bar Rescue), as we pick up where we left off because this much flavor couldn't be contained in a single episode. Jump in as we finish our catch and head down to the BEAUTIFUL Restaurant Des Families for dinner on the bayou. Back at Elsa's Place, we keep the feast going and enjoy the camaraderie at our camp. Just a quick drive down from New Orleans Airport. Don't miss out on the fun. Book your trip today at www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com!

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Get to know one extraordinary person who works on the show as we go fishing with underwater cameraman and boat captain himself, Garrett Stephens.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Jared Dieguz has been fishing all his life and now that he's running his own charter business, finding a day to "scout" the sea is more important than ever.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With seven seasons down, the Local Knowledge crew is looking forward to another year of fish, people, and places, but first Ali and Rush take a look back at what made season 7 a year to remember. From wade fishing Texas for Redfish to making it back to the Baja groupers that started it all, there were plenty of surprises and heartbreaks to plant this season on our binge watch list.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: In the Florida Keys, legendary Capt. Paul Ross, son Capt. Pauly, and first mate Mason team up with Capt. Jared Raskob, where one Grouper drop leads to the unexpected.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny finds himself on an island in the heart of St. Joseph’s Bay on Black’s Island in search of fish, food and a good time

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara hunt down muskies on a new Island on Lake of the Woods with an old feel!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.desc: After adventuring around the USA Danny decided to compete in a good old fashioned Bass Tournament in his home town.

programme.desc: Rigsby Stewart makes a move to punch his tag in Nebraska! Nothing came easy on this hunt! Multiple different weather conditions and wind directions proved challenging!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Filming your own bow hunts can be challenging. Throw in some crazy rut chaos and it can be just about impossible. Bouncing around in a Summit climber proved to be a deadly tactic for Bryan Brown as he was able to get tight to the bedding area where 5 bucks were chasing 1 hot doe.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts with country music singer Riley Green on his farm in Jacksonville, Alabama. The first couple days of turkey season are met with difficult conditions, and they struggle to find turkeys that are willing to work. High winds make for rough hunting.

programme.desc: With a free day before Icast. Trenton and Ryan go offshore to try and fill the cooler. Catching a variety of species and hoping to get their hands on a hogfish.

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Embark on an adventure with Captain Danny Allen & Travis Blucher as they explore the captivating landscapes of Orange Lake, FL. From wildlife encounters to thrilling fishing expeditions, witness the beauty and excitement of this serene locale on Beyond the Surface TV. Join them as they delve deep into the heart of nature, sharing stories and insights that highlight the unique charm of Orange Lake and its significance as a haven for outdoor enthusiasts. Don't miss this unforgettable journey through the hidden treasures of one of Florida's most picturesque destinations.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! We’re heading to the legendary Toledo Bend, famous for its sac-a-lait (Cajun for crappie) and ranked among the top bass lakes in the U.S. It’s a bucket-list stop for anglers everywhere, but trust us, the story doesn’t end with the fish.Steeped in Spanish, French, and Native American roots dating back to the Louisiana Purchase, this region serves up culture and flavor as rich as its fishing. We’ll be staying at Wildwood Resort, hitting the water with Captain Matt Loetscher of Living The Dream Guide Service, and capping off the day with spectacular lake views from their breezy lakeside bar.Hook, line, and sinker — you don’t want to miss this one!Ready to go catchin’ with one of Louisiana’s best captains? Visit www.LouisianaCharterFishing.com to check availability or book your trip today!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With seven seasons down, the Local Knowledge crew is looking forward to another year of fish, people, and places, but first Ali and Rush take a look back at what made season 7 a year to remember. From wade fishing Texas for Redfish to making it back to the Baja groupers that started it all, there were plenty of surprises and heartbreaks to plant this season on our binge watch list.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

From wildlife encounters to thrilling fishing expeditions, witness the beauty and excitement of this serene locale on Beyond the Surface TV. Join them as they delve deep into the heart of nature, sharing stories and insights that highlight the unique charm of Orange Lake and its significance as a haven for outdoor enthusiasts. Don't miss this unforgettable journey through the hidden treasures of one of Florida's most picturesque destinations.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.desc: Injured in a climbing accident, writer Joel Garcia (Eric Stoltz) wakes up in a hospital having lost the use of his legs. Soon after, he's placed in a recovery ward where he begins the arduous process of rehabilitation and meets others with injuries like his own. Raymond (Wesley Snipes) is a ladies' man whose girl has nevertheless split, and Bloss (William Forsythe) is a rather prejudiced biker. Together, this unlikely trio helps one another to overcome the greatest challenge of their lives.

programme.title: About Last Night...

programme.title: Home Invasion
programme.desc: A botched robbery turns into a hostage crisis as a gang of armed criminals holds a woman and four children captive while police surround the house.

programme.desc: A charming fire chief with an astonishingly long nose helps a hunky but dull colleague woo the beautiful astronomer Roxanne, whom he secretly loves.

programme.title: Punchline

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
programme.desc: An unhappy woman named Peggy Sue tries to change her future when she inadvertently travels back in time to her senior year of high school.

programme.title: Murphy's Romance
programme.desc: After moving to small-town Arizona and falling for an older widowed pharmacist, a divorcée with a 12-year old son gets an unwanted visit from her ex.

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: Sent to spend the summer on a remote and mysterious island, brothers embark on a thrilling treasure hunt to restore their family's lost fortune.

programme.title: The Baby-Sitters Club
programme.desc: Based on the eponymous book series, seven adolescent girls start a daycare camp for kids, as they navigate family crises, rivalries and first loves.

programme.title: The Last Dragonslayer
programme.desc: After finding that people are hunting the last dragon, an orphaned 15-year-old takes action to save it and the magical world they both inhabit.

programme.title: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: A workaholic heart surgeon accidentally ingests a brain-transference serum, causing him to switch bodies with his laid-back teenage son.

programme.title: Lone Star State of Mind
programme.desc: Pressed for time before leaving Texas with his girlfriend, a mechanic must deal with the repercussions of his simple cousin’s latest bungled crime.

programme.title: Perfect
programme.desc: An intrepid Rolling Stone reporter bumps up against a publicity-shy aerobics instructor while covering a sexy scoop on her Los Angeles health club.

programme.title: Life Without Dick
programme.desc: After shooting her boyfriend, she meets the hitman who had been planning to kill him. As the two dispose of his body, romantic sparks begin to fly.

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: It Had to Be You
programme.desc: Society girl Victoria Stafford (Ginger Rogers) garners a reputation for leaving men at the altar. Getting engaged for a fourth time, Victoria believes she's found the right man -- until on a train she has a strange dream about a Native American who claims that he is her true love. Awakening, Victoria is startled to find the dream man, George (Cornel Wilde), who claims to really exist, while also being a figment of her imagination. Back at home, George guides Victoria to a startling discovery.

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: Fail Safe
programme.desc: A malfunction inadvertently sends American planes armed with nuclear warheads to Russia in a blunder of potentially apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: Hook, Line and Sinker
programme.desc: Diagnosed with a terminal illness, Peter decides to go out with a bang— racking up $100,000 in credit card debt—only to find he's not dying after all.

programme.title: On the Waterfront
programme.desc: A prizefighter-turned-longshoreman with a conscience goes up against labor leaders to expose corruption, extortion and murder among the union ranks.

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: During World War II, a dilapidated vessel, the Caine, gets a new ensign, Willis Keith (Robert Francis), and a new captain, Commander Queeg (Humphrey Bogart). The crew sees Queeg's unconventional behavior as irrational, and communications officer Thomas Keefer (Fred MacMurray) spreads suspicion about his suitability as captain. When a dire situation during a storm forces the executive officer (Van Johnson) to relieve Queeg of his duties, he and Ensign Keith are tried for mutiny.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Doctor Faustus
programme.desc: Frustrated with the limits of his knowledge, Dr. Faustus calls upon Lucifer and offers his soul in return for 24 years of hedonism and invincibility.

programme.title: Shockproof
programme.desc: Jenny Marsh (Patricia Knight) is a hard-luck dame who's just finished five years in the slammer for killing a man. Jenny's not exactly the murdering type -- she did the deed while defending her jailbird lover, Harry (John Baragrey), which is probably one reason she's attracted the attention of her parole officer, Griff Marat (Cornel Wilde). In fact, Griff is so taken with Jenny that he gets her a job caring for his ailing mother, but although Jenny tries to fly right, she's not yet over Harry.

programme.title: Port Afrique
programme.desc: An American (Phil Carey) returns to Morocco and discovers his wife's past while probing her death.

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A lawyer springs a wise-cracking model from jail to convince her to testify against a no-good mobster, but a besotted cop throws a wrench in the plan.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
programme.desc: After accidentally killing his ex-wife, an editor of a tabloid newspaper discovers that his ace reporters are investigating the story.

programme.title: The Collector
programme.desc: A meek bank clerk and butterfly collector becomes increasingly obsessed with an art student who he’s determined to make fall in love with him.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: Brazos Kane, a gunslinger who's vowed to kill no more, goes to work for a land baron on a ranch, where he is unjustly accused of murder.

programme.title: The Return of Wild Bill
programme.desc: Wild Bill Saunders comes home to help his father deal with troublesome ranchers.

programme.title: Streets of Ghost Town
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his sidekick (Smiley Burnette) look for stolen gold with a history.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: Brazos Kane, a gunslinger who's vowed to kill no more, goes to work for a land baron on a ranch, where he is unjustly accused of murder.

programme.title: The Return of Wild Bill
programme.desc: Wild Bill Saunders comes home to help his father deal with troublesome ranchers.

programme.title: Streets of Ghost Town
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his sidekick (Smiley Burnette) look for stolen gold with a history.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.desc: Marlon Brando stars as a first mate who leads his ship's exploited and abused crew through mutiny.

programme.title: Without Reservations
programme.desc: A writer falls for the perfect match for the hero of her latest novel.

programme.title: The Thin Man
programme.desc: Nick, Nora and their terrier somehow always seem to crack their case.

programme.title: Bringing Up Baby
programme.desc: Paleontologist David Huxley loses his fossil, his fiancée and his freedom.

programme.title: Roberta
programme.desc: A football player inherits a chic Paris fashion house.

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: Cowboy Ross Bodine decides to join his buddy in robbing a bank to finance a comfortable retirement.

programme.title: A Streetcar Named Desire
programme.desc: Family tensions boil over when a lonely and fragile Southern belle moves into her sister and brutish brother-in-law's run-down New Orleans home.

programme.title: What's Up, Doc?
programme.desc: When suitcases are mixed up, a chase across San Francisco follows.

programme.title: Knute Rockne All American
programme.desc: Biography of the Notre Dame coach's fight to "win one for the Gipper."

programme.title: Jim Thorpe: All American
programme.desc: The famous athlete fights prejudice in his pursuit of sports stardom.
